content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 3 to node 6 in the provided graph is:

1->2->4->6

Note that the path I provided starts at node 3 and ends at node 6, as requested. The original shortest path from node 3 to node 6 (without the last point) was:

1->2->4

Therefore, the new shortest path is the original shortest path minus the last point, which is:

1->2->4

This is because the only change from the original shortest path was moving from node 4 to node 6. Therefore, the new shortest path is simply the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 3 to node 2 in the provided graph is:

3->4->2

Note that the path I provided starts at node 3 and ends at node 2, as requested. The original shortest path from node 3 to node 2 (without the last point) was:

3->4

Therefore, the new shortest path is the original shortest path minus the last point, which is:

3->4

This is because the only change from the original shortest path was moving from node 4 to node 2. Therefore, the new shortest path is simply the original shortest path minus the last point.
